definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The guske music is played on traditional string instrument.
sentences.chinese: 卡搜音樂是在傳統的管絃樂器上彈奏的。

sentences.english: The band started to play a 38)twangy tune.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊開始彈奏一首撥絃樂。

sentences.english: Let me play it here a little bit.
He had a beautiful deep voice, and played an instrument called a banjo.
sentences.chinese: 他有着一副低沉動聽的嗓音，還會彈奏班卓琴。

sentences.english: He was like a taut string; you can play the notes from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一根繃緊的弦，時不時可以彈奏出音符。

sentences.english: It can be said that Guqin players are always facing the universe.
sentences.chinese: 彈奏古琴，即是面對天地日月。

sentences.english: Appreciation and piano-playing compose these two dominant parts .
sentences.chinese: 欣賞和彈奏共同組成鋼琴課兩大主要內容。

sentences.english: Jacky played the guitar and sang together with children.
sentences.chinese: 梁俊淇同學一邊彈奏着吉他，一邊和孩子們唱歌。

sentences.english: He plays the piano with surprising facility.
A voice played the notes inside her.
sentences.chinese: 在她的心裏，有一個聲音在彈奏着音符。

sentences.english: He played a piano sonata of his own composition.
sentences.chinese: 他彈奏了一首自作的鋼琴奏鳴曲。

sentences.english: Lyres were played by the ancient Greeks.
My fingers like an idle breeze , are playing upon my heart the music of the ripples.
sentences.chinese: 我的手指如慵懶的微風在心頭彈奏着潺潺的音樂。

sentences.english: As she played, she saw that the children were the thinnest of all.
sentences.chinese: 當她彈奏的時候，她發現小孩瘦得最厲害。

sentences.english: I'm going to play this song in a lower key.
sentences.chinese: 我將以低音調彈奏這首歌曲。

sentences.english: She doodled in her small room.
sentences.chinese: 她在小房間裏隨意彈奏。

definition: (of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
to eject/to exit from/to pop up
to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim
